channel.title: City from ip
channel.description:
After searching around for a long time, I cannot come to the answer to this question. When I go to pageflakes.com or I see a porno ad on some site it always says something like "horny girls in daytona beach" [which is where i live.] or it gives me the whether in my city.
But when you whois or lookup my ip or hostname you always get new york or virginia. The question is how the hell do you get someones exact [b]city[/b] from their ip/hostname, or whatever they are looking up with.

item.title: City from ip
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Sometimes they’ve been spot on for me(and actually got my post code), but most of the time they say I live in Exeter(I’m down southwest a bit more), funnily enough, England ends at Exeter.

Read full topic

item.title: City from ip
item.dc:creator: @wow_raped_XD wow_raped XD
item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

I find it funny when those sites say that kind of shit. They are always around 50 miles off my actuel town.

Read full topic

item.title: City from ip
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

belbn:

Back on topic: does anyone have any tracing sites or methods that can do this?

No because the only reliable ones are the ones you pay for, even then you’re not guaranteed 100% correct results.

Read full topic

item.title: City from ip
item.dc:creator: @belbn belbn
item.description:
@belbn wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:4, topic:230542”][quote author=belbn link=topic=303508.msg2434013#msg2434013 date=1221078750]

ip-adress.com

Are you retarded or can you not read english? I didnt fucking ask this.
[/quote]Are you the kind of person that yells at computers? chill.[/quote]

This site reminds me of

http://www.collegehumor.com/video:1771556

Back on topic: does anyone have any tracing sites or methods that can do this?

Read full topic

item.description:

Blame your ISP, that is they that have done so people can see where you live.
